meanings.definition: To jump farther or higher than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outjumping her friends in the long jump competition.
meanings.sent2: The athlete outjumped all his competitors in the high jump event.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo was outjumping the other animals at the zoo, much to their amazement.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outjump his own limits propelled him to success.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's outjumping ability made it the fastest animal in the savanna.

meanings.definition: The act of jumping farther or higher than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her outjumping in the competition earned her a gold medal.
meanings.sent2: The outjumping of the record holder amazed the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The outjumping of the frog in the pond was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The outjumping of the basketball player was like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The outjumping of the squirrel from tree to tree was a marvel to behold.
